text: Sahibzada Sir Abdul Qayyum Khan (1863 â€“ December 1937) was a distinguished Pashtun educationist and politician of British India. He is best known for establishing the famous Islamia College, Peshawar, along the lines of Sir Syed Ahmed Khan's policy of educating Muslims. He also briefly remained Chief Minister of the NWFP province during 1936-1937. Category:1863 births Category:1937 deaths Category:People of British India
title: Abdul Qayyum Khan
